LanguageData.ColdSnap.letterText: An unusual cold snap has set in. Watch out for hypothermia and dying crops.

LanguageData.Flashstorm.letterText: Extreme amounts of lightning are hitting a small region. This can cause massive fires.

LanguageData.HeatWave.letterText: An unusual heat wave has begun. Watch out for heat stroke.

LanguageData.ToxicFallout.label: TODO
LanguageData.ToxicFallout.letterText:
A distant chemical fire has released a plume of poison over this entire region.

Any person or creature not under a roof will be slowly sickened by the toxic dust settling out of the atmosphere.

It will last for anywhere between a few days to over a month.
LanguageData.VolcanicWinter.label: TODO
LanguageData.VolcanicWinter.letterText: A distant supervolcano has erupted and begun spewing millions of cubic kilometers of ash into the atmosphere.\n\nAsh in the atmosphere will obscure the sun. Temperatures will drop and plants will suffer for lack of sunlight. It could pass in a few weeks, or it might last many months.
